ratings.comment: honeslty the worst professor i have had

He is passionate about culture and Spanish speaking opportunities in the city. He is very educated about literature and linguistics. He is caring and reliable for helping each passionate and motivated student´s success. I enjoyed talking and learning interactively, but some Americans prefer rigid outlines instead.

Arsenio is pretty personable. He rather talk about culture and happening topics that the actual class work. He does favor students, accepts late homework, and takes attendance but do not take advantage of his leniency because he will notice. Try to be on his good side and you will probably get a good grade.

Arsenio was my TA for Spanish 223...I strongly disliked him. In discussion we hardly EVER discussed lecture material, just talked about "culture."  He called on the same 3-4 people in my discussion, giving no one else a chance to earn participation.  Definitely favors people.  Extremely picky with essays, but doesn't give advice on how to improve.

First off, Arsenio is a spanish speaking native from Cuba- so if your going to complain about having a spanish speaker to listen to- dont take him. However, if you want your Spanish abilities to improve- I advise you to take Arsenio. I had him as a TA for 223, and I really enjoyed his class. He may speak quickly, but it helped me pronounce better!

Avoid Arsenio!  I love Spanish, but this class was a HUGE waste of my time!  Arsenio is really nice, but I would rather go to the pub with him than have him as a teacher.  DUE DATES CHANGE ALL THE TIME.  LOTS of busy work, but at least it was easy.  You'll need to learn everything on your own time outside of class to succeed.

Arsenio is a terrible teacher. Avoid him at all costs. I liked spanish and was good at it. I am now not taking anymore spanish. He is unorganized and unclear. He's a nice guy but is just a terrible teacher. He is very willing to meet for help, but a lot of the times he doesnt help at all. He doesn't understand not everyone is a native speaker.
HE IS REALLY HELPFUL TO ME...BUT NOT TO EVERYONE

If you're hoping to improve your Spanish, you're in for a big disappointment. While Arsenio is relatively likable, he is unclear about both class expectations and due dates. Arsenio made me seriously reconsider Spanish as a major; thankfully, not all classes are as bad as his.

Easily the worst teacher I've ever had.Hardly teaches anything in class,and expects you to learn everything from the book.On exams,we even had vocab that wasn't in the book.He tried to explain things in English, which didn't help since he can't speak English very well and has a strong accent.Very unclear grading policy, esp. on written assignments.
He's a fun teacher and he genuinely wants his students to do well.  He gets really excited about teaching and his class isn't hard as long as you do the homework.

You don't do much in class, he doesn't teach and than expects you to learn it all on your own.  Always changes due dates and doesn't give much warning for exam dates.  Corrects a lot on papers, but only explains  his marks if you go office hours where I have had to wait at least an hour almost everytime.  Plus accent is hard to understand.

This is definitely a class where you don't do much.  There is no learning involved, and minimal review.  The due dates are always changed, and most of the time people don't know what is going on.  On the plus side, if you go to office hours he will help you a ton, and you will probably get a fair grade.  Be prepared to talk in class!

If you're looking for a class where you sit around and do nothing, this is it.  As a Spanish major, I was very upset that I was doing and learning nothing, while the class next door was learning a whole bunch.  He's not very helpful with his corrections and the due dates for things are never what he says they are.  Have fun with this one.
